Uses of Class
chess.ChessPiece

  • Uses of ChessPiece in chess

    Subclasses of ChessPiece in chess 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    class  Bishop
    This class represents a bishop and is used to identify all of the moves a bishop can make.
    class  EmptyPiece
    This class represents a spot on the chess board that does not contain a piece.
    class  King
    This class represents a king and is used to identify all of the moves a king can make.
    class  Knight
    This class represents a knight and is used to identify all of the moves a knight can make.
    class  Pawn
    This class represents a pawn and is used to identify all of the moves a pawn can make.
    class  Queen
    This class represents a queen and is used to identify all of the moves a queen can make.
    class  Rook
    This class represents a rook and is used to identify all of the moves a rook can make.
    Methods in chess with parameters of type ChessPiece 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.util.ArrayList<Move> Bishop.getMoves​(ChessPiece[][] board)
    Finds all the moves the bishop can make.
    abstract java.util.ArrayList<Move> ChessPiece.getMoves​(ChessPiece[][] board)
    Finds all the moves a piece can make.
    java.util.ArrayList<Move> EmptyPiece.getMoves​(ChessPiece[][] board)
    No moves can be made by an empty piece.
    java.util.ArrayList<Move> King.getMoves​(ChessPiece[][] board)
    Finds all the moves the king can make.

    Finds all the moves the knight can make.

    Finds all the moves the pawn can make.

    Finds all the moves the queen can make.
